channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Power is restored to nearly all of Puerto Rico after a major blackout
item.description: Lights returned to households as well as to Puerto Rico's hospitals, water plants and sewage facilities after the massive outage that exposed the pers...

item.title: A man who killed at least 12 people in a shooting spree in Montenegro dies by suicide
item.description: A gunman who fatally shot at least 12 people, including two children, in Montenegro has killed himself while surrounded by police, officials said Thur...

item.title: Here's what we know so far about the deadly attack in New Orleans
item.description: In the early hours of New Year's Day, a truck rammed into crowds on the French Quarter's heavily foot-trafficked street. Police are looking into wheth...

item.title: Firework mortars, gas canisters inside Tesla that exploded by Trump's Las Vegas hotel
item.description: The items were found in the Cybertruck that exploded outside President-elect Donald Trump's hotel on Wednesday, killing a suspect in the vehicle and s...

item.title: A former American football player and an aspiring nurse among those killed
item.description: The identities of those killed in New Orleans are starting to emerge as families pay tribute.

item.title: Moment New Orleans attacker enters busy street in pick-up truck
item.description: CCTV catches moment pick-up truck turns into a busy street in New Orleans killing several people.

item.title: What we know about a vehicle attack on pedestrians in New Orleans that killed at least 15
In the Country with the World's Worst Displacement Crisis: Sudan (Encore)
item.description: Fighting between the Sudanese army and a paramilitary group have displaced some 12 million people in one of Africa's biggest countries. In a story we ...

item.title: Details emerge about the victims of deadly New Orleans attack
item.description: At least 15 people were killed after a driver slammed into a crowd celebrating New Year's on Bourbon Street in New Orleans.

item.title: Police probe if blast at Trump hotel is linked to New Orleans attack
item.description: President Biden said "any possible connection" was being investigated, but "thus far, there is nothing to report".

item.title: 10 teens wounded in Queens mass shooting, police say
item.description: A mass shooting in Queens, NYC left 10 teenagers wounded outside the Amazura Concert Hall in Jamaica.

item.title: Toxic waste from Bhopal gas leak factory removed after 40 years
item.description: The deadly gas leak at the Union Carbide factory in central India killed thousands in 1984.

item.title: Gunman kills 12 people including 2 kids in Montenegro shooting spree
item.description: Officials say a gunman opened fire at multiple locations in Montenegro, killing a dozen people before turning the gun on himself.

item.title: An aspiring nurse, a football star, a single mother and a father of 2 killed in New Orleans attack

item.description: New Orleans attack under investigation after driver slams into crowd, killing at least 15; Cybertruck explosion outside Trump Hotel in Las Vegas inves...

item.title: The 119th Congress begins tomorrow. Here's what to know.
item.description: The 119th Congress begins Friday with Republicans in full control of the House and Senate for the first time since 2019. Here's what to know.

item.title: Hamas police chief among 11 killed in Israeli strike on Gaza, medics say
item.description: Three children and two women were also reportedly among the 11 killed at a tent camp.
